alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 7:18PM MDT until August 22 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DONA ANA AND NORTHWESTERN EL PASO COUNTIES... At 718 PM MDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, East El Paso, Mission Valley, Santa Teresa, Sunland Park, Fort Bliss, Biggs Field and Franklin Mountains State Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
